body_html:
It shouldn't be too hard to unify the formatting for example code in docs. I think we only need to figure out when code gets printed -- are there other things that I'm not taking into account here?

ie if we get something like

>>> x = torch.randn(4, 4)
>>> x.size()
torch.Size([4, 4])
>>> y = x.view(16)
>>> y.size()
torch.Size([16])
>>> z = x.view(-1, 8)  # the size -1 is inferred from other dimensions
>>> z.size()
torch.Size([2, 8])

then the rule for printing things is "follow the python interpreter".

body:
It shouldn't be too hard to unify the formatting for example code in docs. I think we only need to figure out when code gets printed -- are there other things that I'm not taking into account here?

ie if we get something like
```
>>> x = torch.randn(4, 4)
>>> x.size()
torch.Size([4, 4])
>>> y = x.view(16)
>>> y.size()
torch.Size([16])
>>> z = x.view(-1, 8)  # the size -1 is inferred from other dimensions
>>> z.size()
torch.Size([2, 8])
```
then the rule for printing things is "follow the python interpreter".
